channel.title: Homepage on Robbert-Jan 't Hoen
channel.description: Recent content in Homepage on Robbert-Jan 't Hoen

item.title: Vectorizing R code
item.author: robbertjan-1994@hotmail.com (Robbert-Jan 't Hoen)
item.description: The beginning … Somewhere last January I began my R adventure, which means that I have been programming with it for almost five months now. Prior to this period, my only experiences with R have been very frustrating, to say the least. These might have occurred while I was looking for the implementation of an obscure econometrical method or the one or two times that I tried to learn R and failed miserably.

item.title: First blog post
item.author: robbertjan-1994@hotmail.com (Robbert-Jan 't Hoen)
item.description: And let there be ligth! After a few days of troubleshooting, I have finally succeeded in launching my first website with Hugo, hurray! I will start this website off by giving a brief overview of my current setup and stating my intentions for the shorter-term. Website setup My current setup is GitHub Pages + Hugo + Blogdown as recommended in this excellent tutorial by Amber Thomas. This allows me to create rich web content by utilizing Rmarkdown files with the blogdown package in Rstudio.

item.title: About
item.author: robbertjan-1994@hotmail.com (Robbert-Jan 't Hoen)
item.description: Getting to know me I am Robbert-Jan ’t Hoen, a 22 year old student living in the neighbourhood of Rotterdam, the Netherlands. I hold a bachelor in Econometrics and Operations Research, and am currently pursuing a master in Quantitative Finance. My interests are mainly concerned with mathematics, statistics, machine learning, renewable energy, healthcare, new technologies, and almost all sports. Purpose of the website My motivation for building this website is threefold:
